name: go
subtitle: Go
about: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

videos.title: Underscore library for Go
videos.description: Toby presents his controversial Underscore library at golang-syd in July 2014.

videos.title: Writing, building, installing and testing Go code
videos.description: This screencast describes setting up a workspace (GOPATH), writing commands and packages, using the go tool to build and install, and using the testing package to write unit tests.

videos.title: Testing Techniques
videos.description: This talk was initially presented by Andrew Gerrand at Google I/O 2014 at the Go Developer Sandbox.

videos.title: Writing your own Go compiler
videos.description: In this video, it'll be explaining the Go potential as a very portable language and reviewing the Go tools that make that such an exciting possibility to write a Go compiler.

videos.title: Using Go for a simple HTTP Request
videos.description: How to do a simple HTTP Request using the net/http package in the Go standard library.

videos.title: Using Go to fetch and parse JSON
videos.description: Using Go to fetch JSON from a webservice, and then parse it.

videos.title: Concurrency with buffered channels
videos.description: Using Channels with Go for communicating with different parts of a concurrent app, and how a buffered channel provides a blocking feature.

videos.title: Watching multiple channels
videos.description: How to wait for multiple channels with Go.

videos.title: A Tour of Go
videos.description: Three things that make Go fast, fun, and productive for me: interfaces, reflection, and concurrency. Builds a toy web crawler to demonstrate these.

videos.title: Getting Started with Go
videos.description: How to setup your environment and write a Hello World application using the Go programming language.

videos.title: Go Language Basics
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy covers the basics of variables, functions and loops in Go.

videos.title: Martini and Markdown
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy builds a simple Martini web application that parses and presents Markdown.

videos.title: Postgres: Basics
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy covers how to setup and connect to a Postgres database with Go.

videos.title: HTML Templates
videos.description: Jeremy makes his books output prettier by using Bootstrap and HTML Templates.

videos.title: Postgres: Inserting Data
videos.description: Jeremy continues with his Martini web application and adds the ability to insert book data into the database.

videos.title: Auth: Part 1
videos.description: Jeremy covers basic authentication with Martini.

videos.title: Auth: Part 2
videos.description: Jeremy covers basic authentication with Martini.

videos.title: Auth: Part 3
videos.description: Jeremy covers basic authentication with Martini.
